poem:
Title: An Ode to 'The Holdovers'

Within school walls, a drama spun,
Alexander Payne's masterpiece, unsung.
In whispers of celluloid, the tale unfurls,
A hit of nostalgia, like pearls.
Who dare scorn this cinematic feat,
That in the hearts of many takes seat.
Best picture Oscar, predict it might,
The Holdovers shine bright in the movie night.
